segment.source: Label the Current Version of a GPO
segment.target: Label the Current Version of a GPO

segment.source: Label the Current Version of a GPO
segment.target: Label the Current Version of a GPO

segment.source: Label the Current Version of a GPO
segment.target: Label the Current Version of a GPO

segment.source: You can label the current version of a Group Policy Object (GPO) for easy identification in its history.
segment.target: You can label the current version of a Group Policy Object (GPO) for easy identification in its history.

segment.source: You can use a label to identify a known good version to which you could roll back if a problem occurs.
segment.target: You can use a label to identify a known good version to which you could roll back if a problem occurs.

segment.source: Also, by labeling multiple GPOs with the same label at one time, you can mark related GPOs that should be rolled back to the same point if rollback should later be necessary.
segment.target: Also, by labeling multiple GPOs with the same label at one time, you can mark related GPOs that should be rolled back to the same point if rollback should later be necessary.

segment.source: A user account with the Editor, Approver, or AGPM Administrator (Full Control) role or necessary permissions in Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) is required to complete this procedure.
segment.target: A user account with the Editor, Approver, or AGPM Administrator (Full Control) role or necessary permissions in Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) is required to complete this procedure.

segment.source: Review the details in "Additional considerations" in this topic.
segment.target: Review the details in "Additional considerations" in this topic.

segment.source: To label the current version of GPOs in their histories
segment.target: To label the current version of GPOs in their histories

segment.source: In the Group Policy Management Console tree, click Change Control in the forest and domain in which you want to manage GPOs.
segment.target: In the Group Policy Management Console tree, click Change Control in the forest and domain in which you want to manage GPOs.

segment.source: On the Contents tab, click the Controlled tab to display the controlled GPOs.
segment.target: On the Contents tab, click the Controlled tab to display the controlled GPOs.

segment.source: Click a GPO for which to label the current version.
segment.target: Click a GPO for which to label the current version.

segment.source: To select multiple GPOs, press SHIFT and click the last GPO in a contiguous group of GPOs, or press CTRL and click individual GPOs.
segment.target: To select multiple GPOs, press SHIFT and click the last GPO in a contiguous group of GPOs, or press CTRL and click individual GPOs.

segment.source: Right-click a selected GPO, and then click Label.
segment.target: Right-click a selected GPO, and then click Label.

segment.source: Type a label and a comment to be displayed in the history of each GPO selected, and then click OK.
segment.target: Type a label and a comment to be displayed in the history of each GPO selected, and then click OK.

segment.source: When the Progress window indicates that overall progress is complete, click Close.
segment.target: When the Progress window indicates that overall progress is complete, click Close.

segment.source: Additional considerations
segment.target: Additional considerations

segment.source: By default, you must be an Editor, an Approver, or an AGPM Administrator (Full Control) to perform this procedure.
segment.target: By default, you must be an Editor, an Approver, or an AGPM Administrator (Full Control) to perform this procedure.

segment.source: Specifically, you must have List Contents and either Edit Settings or Deploy GPO permissions for the GPO.
segment.target: Specifically, you must have List Contents and either Edit Settings or Deploy GPO permissions for the GPO.

segment.source: Additional references
segment.target: Additional references

segment.target: Editing a GPO
